abstract.para: This documentation does ABC for FeedHenry 1.

section.title: Logging Module
section.simpara: The RainCatcher Logger Module is a logging facade for node.js based applications and it is used by all RainCatcher modules. The RainCatcher Logger Module is is contained in the raincatcher-core module.

There are two implementations of the RainCatcher Logger module, Bunyan and Console. By default, the Bunyan and the Console implementations are not setup and so, no logging exists by default. Users can use their own loggers by wrapping their logger into the provided class.
For more information, see the Logger Example.

section.title: Using RainCatcher Logger and Setting a Logging Level
Logging Module
section.simpara: The RainCatcher Logger Module is a logging facade for node.js based applications and it is used by all RainCatcher modules. The RainCatcher Logger Module is is contained in the raincatcher-core module.

There are two implementations of the RainCatcher Logger module, Bunyan and Console. By default, the Bunyan and the Console implementations are not setup and so, no logging exists by default. Users can use their own loggers by wrapping their logger into the provided class.
For more information, see the Logger Example.

section.title: Importing the Bunyan Logging Module
section.simpara: To incorporate the Bunyan logging into a project, the RainCatcher Logging Module is imported and then the Bunyan Logging Module is initialized.

listitem.simpara: Add the following code to the file where you want to import the Bunyan Logging:
To log a comment, add the following code after the code directly above:
listitem.programlisting: logger.info('This log will render with BunyanLogger');

listitem.simpara: For more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines

section.title: Setting the Bunyan Logging Level
section.simpara: Determine the logging level you want (for more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines) and set the Bunyan logging level accordingly.

listitem.simpara: The Bunyan Logging Module is imported. For more information, see Importing the Bunyan Logging Module
Directly underneath the code for importing the Bunyan Logging Module, set the <LogLevel>:
For more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines

section.title: Importing the Console Logging Module
section.simpara: To incorporate the Console logging into a project, the RainCatcher Logging Module is imported and then the Console Logging Module is initialized.

listitem.simpara: Add the following code to the file where you want to import the Console Logging:
To log a comment, add the following code after the code directly above:
listitem.programlisting: logger.info('This log will render with ConsoleLogger');

listitem.simpara: For more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines

section.title: Setting the Console Logging Level
section.simpara: Determine the logging level you want (for more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines) and set the Console logging level accordingly.

listitem.simpara: The Console Logging Module is imported. For more information, see Importing the Console Logging Module
Directly underneath the code for importing the Console Logging Module, set the <LogLevel>:
For more information, see Logging Reference Template and Guidelines

section.title: Logging Reference Template and Guidelines
section.simpara: This section describes:

note.simpara: Both the Bunyan and Console modules can both be used for local development and platform development.

section.title: Bunyan and Console Logging Levels
section.simpara: For more information, see link:[https://www.npmjs.com/package/bunyan]Bunyan Levels.
